name: places/ChIJbV3bQSpawokRIkSw6V5vDf0
formattedAddress: 187 Clinton St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 187 Clinton St, New York, NY 10002-5525, USA

originalText.text:
Brought in 7 plain balloons to get filled with air. They said it was going to be $20 ( $22 with tax it ended up being)

The balloons didn't even last a whole day. I was going to fill up a large number 1 balloon but as soon as they said it was going to be another $20 i said no thanks.

The picture is taken the next morning ( filled with air at 3pm and by 12am they were all on the floor/couch)

I've been to different places where it was cheaper and lasts way longer!

I hope this review helps/warns others.

originalText.text: These guys have been here awhile. I can never leave here empty handed. I dig the glass mason jars and little storage things. I got a cool coat rack here for $1.99. Today I bought some bolts and paper towels.

text.text: These guys have been here awhile. I can never leave here empty handed. I dig the glass mason jars and little storage things. I got a cool coat rack here for $1.99. Today I bought some bolts and paper towels.

originalText.text: This store is open one Saturday And then they are closed the next Saturday. It's always a hot or miss with them.

text.text: This store is open one Saturday And then they are closed the next Saturday. It's always a hot or miss with them.

originalText.text: Been going here since i was 5. Love the place! Grandma been coming here as long as its been open!

text.text: Been going here since i was 5. Love the place! Grandma been coming here as long as its been open!

originalText.text:
This store changes the prices at the register. I went in took a pack of napkins after I walk out the store and check my receipt the price from the receipt was different from the price mark in the napkins. I went back and the lady at the register look nervous and didn’t attend me. So I ask the guy he said: no, the price is wrong. While he fixes the prices on all of the rest of the napkins. I told him, it wasn’t my mistake and even do he refuse his wrong. The young lady that also works there approach me very rude and said If I don’t like it I should return the item.
This persons are stealing from the community taking advantage that they are the only store around that neighborhood. **If you guys buy something check your receipts. **
If at least the lady at the register inform me before charging me I wouldn’t mind paying. But the way they handle the situation behind my back. Plus the treatment they gave me as a customer knowing they did the mistake is very unprofessional.
